newsitem.title: USA: Los Angeles County faces $32mln shortfall - official.
newsitem.headline: Los Angeles County faces $32mln shortfall - official.

text.p: Los Angeles County's general fund faces a revenue shortfall of $32.1 million in the 1997-1998 fiscal year, down from $71.2 million in the last forecast, the county's chief administrative office said on Thursday.

Chief Administrative Officer David Janssen said the revised budget shortfall projection assumes an increase in property tax revenue, a boost in the year end fund balance, and additional county savings.
